name: SHIVAM AGARWAL

full_output.summary: I am a fourth-year student with hands-on experience in both frontend and backend web development, including SQL. I am now pivoting towards the exciting fields of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning. With a solid foundation in data structures and algorithms, I am passionate about leveraging technology to solve complex problems and create innovative solutions. My practical experience includes leading and contributing to several impactful ML projects and applying advanced AI techniques.

certifications.title: Design And Analysis Of Algorithms
certifications.issuer: NPTEL Online Certification by Prof. Madhavan Mukund Chennai.

certifications.title: Mastering in DSA using C & C++

education.degree: Bachelor of Technology in Computers Science and Engineering

projects.name: Hand Movement Recognizer
projects.description: Developed a machine learning-based Hand Movement Recognizer project to interpret and classify various hand gestures.

projects.name: Food order prediction
projects.description: Headed the development of a machine learning-based Food Order prediction system to forecast customer food choices.

projects.name: Human Activity - Recognition using smartphone
projects.description: Engineered a machine learning model to classify six human activities using smartphone sensor data from kaggle.

projects.name: Chatbot for Manipal University Jaipur
projects.description: Collaborated on developing an AI-powered multilingual chatbot for Manipal University Jaipur as part of a course project team.

full_output.name: SHIVAM AGARWAL
achievements_and_awards: Logistics Core team member in PolygonXGuild Event.
Executive Comittee Member of IEEE Student Chapter.
publications: Machine Learning for Malware Detection (May 2024) Mathematical Modeling, Computational Intelligence Techniques and Renewable Energy (MMCITRE-2024). Concluded a research project on malware detection using machine learning algorithms, culminating in a paper presented at MMCITRE2024 Conference. Engineered a robust malware detection system utilizing Random Forest and Decision Tree classifiers; implemented feature selection techniques to optimize model performance, reducing the feature set from 55 to 13 key attributes.
ASR Literature Review (Nov 2023) Conducted in-depth literature review on Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) technologies.

degree: Bachelor of Technology in Computers Science and Engineering
